dialogues.MA:
[1]Mind over matter. 
[2]Guess what we're going to make later. 
[3]A cake. 
[4]But for real. 
[5]Come on slow poke.

[7]Good choice! 
[8]Off, please.

[10]Oh, that's pretty normal. 
[11]Everything's hunky-dory.

[13]You'll be as strong as Samson soon. 
[14]Gigantic. 
[15]Good word sandwich. 
[16]Come on, you can read Dylan yourself. 
[17]Heeeeeeeere's Dylan, the sturdy digger! / The loads he shovels get bigger and bigger. / Watch his long arm delve into the earth, / No excavator so loves to munch dirt. 
[18]Our friend Table... just isn't able. 
[19]Our friend Knife runs for his life. 
[20]Abracadabra! 
[21]Jack - 
[22]Sorry. I have to ask for stuff we really need that he can get easily. 
[23]Try your cake, I bet it's delicioso. 
[24]Next year, you mean. 
[25]But one day the mermaid finds where the fisherman hid her comb. 
[26]So she runs home to the sea. 
[27]Of course she takes her Baby Jack with her. 
[28]No, he's half-merman. He can breathe air or water, whichever. 
[29]... and Edmond swims and swims to the island of Monte Cristo and digs up all the treasure, and ...

[31]We've brushed our teeth already. 
[32]Jack, it's late. Come on. 
[33]Hey. 
[34]Thanks. 
[35]
[36]Shh. 
[37]Cheap piece of ... 
[38]Maybe she's tired. 
[39]They'd steal our food. 
[40]They'd bring in germs, bite us in the night. 
[41]No I didn't, he's hunky-dory. 
[42]I swear, he's safe at home with his Ma in the backyard. 
[43]Hey, let's make a UFO with this. 
[44]Because he's not our friend. 
[45]You shouldn't hear what he - You're meant to be asleep. 
[46]He didn't mean it. 
[47]Jack. We can't have a dog. We don't have room - - space, enough space - cooped up in here with the barking, the scratching... 
[48]There is no Lucky! 
[49]He's just made-up, in your head, he's not real. 
[50]Right here in Room. 
[51]We're never anywhere but here. 
[52]Jack. Go to sleep. 
[53]You can open it. 
[54]I guess they still can't hear us. 
[55]Jack! 
[56]Sorry, I burned some cheese. 
[57]I will. I wasn't thinking. 
[58]I know. I'm really sorry. 
[59]The vitamins? 
[60]If we had a better diet, maybe... 
[61]I'm sorry. 
[62]No. 
[63]You. 
[64]What do you mean? 
[65]No, but - 
[66]What are you going to do? 
[67]Are you... looking for another job? 
[68]He's asleep. 
[69]Let's go to bed. 
[70]Now. 
[71]Please. 
[72]Get away from him! Get away! 
[73]Just leave him alone. 
[74]It's OK. 
[75]He's cut the power. 
[76]Lately. 
[77]Lunch! 
[78]We have to use them up before they rot. Once we eat we'll feel warmer. 
[79]Soon. 
[80]Once he's not mad with me anymore. 
[81]Jack.   Think about it. 
[82]No anything. 
[83]Hey Jack. Remember the mouse? 
[84]You know where he is right now? 
[85]On the other side of this wall. 
[86]Oh Jack, everything has two sides. 
[87]No, that's - 
[88]But a wall's like this. And we're on the inside, in Room, and Mouse is on the outside, see? 
[89]No, in the world.   It's much closer than Outer Space. 
[90]But if we were outside in the world, we would, we'd be looking at the other side of this wall, and Mouse lying in the grass with his Ma. We'd see trees and cars and - 
[91]Is it, though? You know when Door opens and the air comes in, the air that smells fresher - that's grass. 
[92]But it's not TV. It's the real world we smell. You're so smart, I know you've started wondering. 
[93]Where do you think Old Nick gets our food? 
[94]There's no magic! Everything we see on TV - it's pictures of real stuff and real people in the world. 
[95]No, sorry, not Dora, she's just a picture, but the other ones, with faces like ours - and there's real streets and oceans, dogs, cats - 
[96]Just out there, in the world. 
[97]Look! A leaf! 
[98]On skylight. 
[99]On the trees they are but when they fall they rot, like salad, in the fridge, they -. 
[100]Well, we can't see them from here because the skylight looks upwards instead of sideways. 
[101]No I'm not. 
[102]Jack. I couldn't explain before, you were too small to understand, so.. I had to make up a story. 
[103]But now - it's the opposite of lying, I'm unlying, because now you're five I think you can understand about the world, you have to understand. 
[104]Jack - 
[105]You know how Alice wasn't always in Wonderland? 
[106]Well, I'm like Alice. I wasn't always in Room. 
[107]I used to be a little girl called Joy. I lived- 
[108]I lived in a house out in the world - with my mom and dad. You'd call them Grandma and Grandpa. 
[109]The house where we lived, with a hammock in the back yard. We used to swing in the hammock and eat ice cream. 
[110]It's not TV, Jack. Are you listening? 
[111]And then I was nearly grown up, I was seventeen, I was walking to school and - 
[112]Still up in heaven. So this guy ran up to me, saying his - 
[113]We call him Old Nick, but I don't know his real name. He pretended his dog was sick, he seemed really - 
[114]There was no dog. It was just a trick to get me into his truck. Old Nick stole me. 
[115]You need to hear this one. He put me in his garden shed. 
[116]Here. Room's the shed. He's the only one with the code - secret numbers to open the door. I've been locked in here for seven years. Do you understand? 
[117]Jack, the world. You wouldn't believe how big it is. Room's only a tiny stinky piece of it. 
[118]
[119]Fine. That's fine Jack. 
[120]Apple? 
[121]About time. 
[122]Sure, if you want it. 
[123]Totally real. I had a pet turtle. 
[124]They're all real. 
[125]Ah, they're real people playing dress-up, pretending to be people from hundreds of years ago. 
[126]You're getting it! 
[127]Jack. 
[128]One night I stood behind the door with the lid of the toilet tank - 
[129]- it used to have a lid, it was the heaviest thing in Room. When he came in I tried to smash it down on his head. But I messed up, Jack. He shoved the door shut and grabbed me by the wrist - that's why it's sore now. 
[130]Yes we could, but then we'd have no more food - and we wouldn't know the code, on the door, to get out. 
[131]They don't know where we are, Jack. Room's not on any map. 
[132]Jack, I want you to listen to me. Jack! 
[133]You're old enough now and we can't wait any longer ... Jack you are going to help me trick Old Nick like Jack in the stories is always tricking the giant. 
[134]I'm going to make your face so scorching hot that Old Nick will take you to the hospital in his truck, and the minute you get there you'll tell the doctors, 'Help! Police! 
[135]I'll write you a note to give them. 
[136]I won't be in the hospital, I'll be here. 
[137]It'll be OK. 
[138]He won't take us both. You'll go first, just to the hospital so you can tell the police, and then... 
[139]Then you'll come rescue me. 
[140]We'll be free. Go on hikes, see birds. Ride in cars and trains and planes. I'll teach you to swim. We'll have friends. And a dog - we'll call him Lucky. A party with a cake with candles, our friends singing. 
[141]Tonight. 
[142]It has to be tonight. 
[143]Listen to me. 
[144]I'm going to tell him the powercut made you so cold, you got a fever. We might not get another chance. It's a miracle he didn't come last night. 
[145]I'm your Ma. Sometimes I have to pick for both of us. 
[146]You need to feel hot when he touches you. 
[147]Crying's good, it makes you look sicker. 
[148]And stay floppy, remember? You're too weak to move or say a word. 
[149]Makes you smell sick. 
[150]Remember when you get to the hospital you give them the note. Show me how you hold it out. 
[151]What's that. 
[152]See, that's a bit of me you have with you all the time. 
[153]I know. 
[154]There you are! 
[155]Sorry, just - Jack's really bad. 
[156]It was so cold. 
[157]I couldn't keep him warm, and now he's burning. 
[158]I've tried, he pukes them back up. 
[159]Don't - 
[160]He's only five! Dehydrated, temperature this high, he could go into convulsions any minute. 
[161]He needs antibiotics. 
[162]Tomorrow night? You have to take him to the ER right now. 
[163]I'm begging you. Please! 
[164]If you're even halfway human - 
[165]So Edmond pulls his friend's body out of the bag and hides it, and he climbs into the bag, and lies super still until the guards come. 
[166]And that's what you're going to do. 
[167]See? It's even tricksier than pretending to be sick: this time you're going to be dead. 
[168]Rug's going to be the bag, see? 
[169]Pretending to be dead, that's all. Wrapped up so Old Nick can't see that you're alive. But not floppy this time. All stiff like a robot. And not a sound. And I'll be in your head, talking to you all the time. 
[170]He's going to carry you outside, all rolled up in Rug, and he'll put you in the back of his pick-up and drive somewhere to bury you - 
[171]It's OK. You'll wriggle free and jump out of the truck. You'll - 
[172]Come on, Jack, let's try rolling you up. 
[173]Please Jack, try just for a minute. 
[174]
[175]Okey-dokey. 
[176]Excellent! He'll pick you up - stay stiff as you can. 
[177]Remember your superpowers. 
[178]Ok, it's too many turns. Up, up. I'll fold the end over like this. Now lie down and fold your arms like this. 
[179]Push, Jack. 
[180]Now roll. 
[181]OK. Take a breath. 
[182]You're getting yourself out. 
[183]If you panic, Old Nick will hear that you're alive, and he'll be mad. 
[184]You did it! You're the banana! 
[185]That's OK. I brought you here to Room. I didn't mean to but I did, and I've always been so glad. And now it's my job to get you out. 
[186]Wait till the truck slows down at the first stop sign - if you jump when it's going fast you might - 
[187]So Truck, Wriggle Out, Jump when it Slows Down... 
[188]Jump, Run, then shout to Somebody and show them the Note. 
[189]Tell them your Ma is Joy Newsome and ­ 
[190]Anybody - the first person you see. 
[191]He's not going to - 
[192]You got Bad Tooth in your pocket? 
[193]You're going to love it. 
[194]The world. Living in the hammock house with your Grandma and Grandpa... 
[195]One evening as the sun went down and the jungle fire was burning, down the track came a hobo hikin', and he said "Boys, I'm not turning. I'm headed for a land that's far away, beside the crystal fountains. So, come with me, we'll go and see the Big - 
[196]He got worse in the night. 
[197]Am I sure? 
[198]You killed my baby. 
[199]Where will you take him? 
[200]Not here. I'd feel him. I'd know. 
[201]Drive him somewhere nice, somewhere with lots of trees. 
[202]Keep him wrapped up. Swear you won't even look at him with your filthy eyes. 
[203]Now. I can't bear it. 
[204]Gently! 
[205]We can do anything. They'll find us somewhere to sleep soon. 
[206]Good morning sleepy head. I was waiting so long for you to wake I fell back asleep. 
[207]Same one, just a different bit. It's a room - A bedroom in a hospital. 
[208]We're not sick. We're the opposite of sick.

[211]That's OK. 
[212]Yes, just now. OK ... if that's OK, thank you. 
[213]Don't worry about that. Someone will wash it. Come on, we have to get ready. 
[214]Do you like it? There's one for you, too. 
[215]We'll get new ones. 
[216]There are going to be so many treats, not just on Sundays. 
[217]It's a shower instead.   Splashier. 
[218]Jack, look. It's us.

[220]What?

[222]That's right. 
[223]It's OK, Jack. 
[224]Is that really necessary? 
[225]OK. Thanks. Try it, it's delicioso.

[227]Nothing happened to Jack. 
[228]But he's OK, right? 
[229]He says he's real, not plastic. 
[230]Dad! 
[231]Jack, Jack it's OK. This is your Grandma and Grandpa. 
[232]Leave them, Jack, you'll get used to them. 
[233]So, what's in Michigan? 
[234]
[235]Whoa. This is not what I thought was happening. 
[236]Wow. 
[237]He has no idea what we've been through. Nothing could compare to that. 
[238]I told him we're going home. Unless, you'd prefer us ... 
[239]OK, this is a lot of stuff. 
[240]What, Jack? 
[241]It's OK. 
[242]Just wait a moment. We'll go inside in a moment. 
[243]I need to go back now, anyway. There are things we need to do inside. 
[244]I know, I'm watching it right now. I can't believe it. I just want to be home now. 
[245]Wait, wait a second. 
[246]I understand. 
[247]Got it. 
[248]Jesus. 
[249]Ready? 
[250]Leo. 
[251]Jack, Grandma's asking if you'd like something to drink. 
[252]Juice? Just some juice. I'm fine. 
[253]They're from people saying they're happy that we're safe and back home. 
[254]Just people. 
[255]Mom, what have you done with the hammock? 
[256]A dog? 
[257]You don't like dogs. 
[258]Just rest. 
[259]Jack says that's where his `strong' is. 
[260]You didn't know I could play piano. Guess this tune... 
[261]We live here now. 
[262]Eat it slower. 
[263]Is there something wrong? 
[264]Why are you in such a hurry? 
[265]You haven't said one word to Jack. 
[266]Yes we do. Look at him. 
[267]Dad. 
[268]Please. 
[269]He's my baby. 
[270]Come on, Jack. Time for bed. 
[271]Hey Jack, you want play with your new toys? 
[272]Jack, you have all those colors. Why don't you use them. You could draw a picture of Jack the giant slayer, with every color. 
[273]I already gave all this information to the last person. What, Jack? 
[274]What? 
[275]Hold on ... I don't understand the words you are using, so why do you keep repeating them? I have done that three times already. 
[276]Have you been outside? 
[277]Leo, please don't ever take Jack outside again unless you know what you're doing. He can be seriously hurt by the sun. 
[278]He has never had any UV. This is serious stuff, OK? 
[279]Look at this. 
[280]You know who that is? 
[281]Me and Stacy Benton and Heather Noel and Laura Sullivan. That's how people did their hair. We were the relay team. I was the anchor. I was fast. We did track together. 
[282]Real track. On a field. We were fast. Best in the district. You know what happened to them? 
[283]Exactly. Nothing. They just lived and nothing happened. Look ... 
[284]No. I don't want to see any more. I don't want you to look at any more right now. Let's just be quiet for while. Okey dokey? 
[285]Do you want to hear something really good? 
[286]Hey listen. Old Nick is going to jail for a really long time. 
[287]But now he'll be there for ever and ever. And I don't have to see him ever again or talk to the judge or any of those scary things. Isn't that great? 
[288]We can stop worrying now and start to do all the things we want. 
[289]I'm talking to people. 
[290]I'm dressed to go out, that's all. 
[291]It's just some clothes and makeup. 
[292]Come on, we need to get you ready. 
[293]It's not too much for me. I need to go out, get some air. 
[294]You could have a better attitude, you know. 
[295]You could support me in this. That's all I'm asking. I'm trying to take a step. 
[296]Oh my God! 
[297]I know. I know. 
[298]This is too weird, sitting in this car right now. 
[299]I'm happy, too. And a little freaked out. 
[300]I always liked her even though we never really hung out. 
[301]That's actually not true. 
[302]Susan Torrey. 
[303]Who was that? 
[304]What work do you do. 
[305]Jack. This way. Just hold my hand. 
[306]You're going to be fine. OK? 
[307]You can't take that, Jack. 
[308]It doesn't belong to you. 
[309]Come on. If you're good we can get another book, a new one on our way out. 
[310]I'm here. OK? Just calm down. 
[311]Don't be. This is normal. This is what people do. 
[312]Remember your superpowers, alright, have fun. And no whining, OK? 
[313]I need some... (she looks around desperately)... some shoes. 
[314]I don't know. 
[315]Please, Jack. 
[316]No. I definitely don't want any of these. I'd never wear these. 
[317]Are you hungry, Jack? You want something in the food court? They've got, I don't know, pizza and stuff. 
[318]I said if you were good. 
[319]No. I said no, so he has to understand. 
[320]Jack, you want a Cinnabon? You smell that? 
[321]Cinnabon is good. You might like it. 
[322]You are being really naughty Jack. 
[323]Suit yourself. 
[324]Get the fuck away from him. Get the fuck away. 
[325]Shit, shit, shit. Those assholes. 
[326]Jesus Christ. Just buckle it, all right? 
[327]That's how it works, all right? 
[328]Well maybe I don't like you either! 
[329]Just go! 
[330]Jack. Please turn that off. 
[331]Now. I mean it. Now. 
[332]Jack! Please. Please. I'm begging you, please turn that off. 
[333]It reminds me too much of Room. I can't have it. 
[334]You've got so many other things to play with. You should try something else. 
[335]Come on. Let's look at all your stuff. 
[336]Look at all these toys. Most kids would love that stuff. You've barely even looked at them. 
[337]Come on, Jack. 
[338]It's pretty cool, right? You like it? 
[339]He needs something real to do. I'm getting worried about him with the phone. 
[340]I don't give him my phone so please don't give him yours. 
[341]I just want him to connect to something. You know? 
[342]I'm sorry, I don't know what's happening to me. I can't feel anything. Even for ... 
[343]Don't judge me. You have no right. People walk around like the world is fine and normal but it's not. 
[344]Don't! I can't bear it. I thought this would be heaven, but it's worse. Can you understand that? 
[345]No I don't! That's not what I need. 
[346]No! That's not what he said. You don't know what he said. That's confidential and you don't even know. Just forget it. 
[347]Oh, I'm sorry! 
[348]You think you know what's in my head. Trust me, you couldn't handle it. 
[349]So you're seeing that every time you look at me? Great. 
[350]Yeah, well you seemed to get on OK without me. 
[351]Actually, that's exactly what I think. 
[352]Don't you ever tell me how to look after my son. I'm sorry if I'm not `nice' enough for you. Maybe if you hadn't been in my head saying `be nice' that day I wouldn't have gone to help him. 
[353]This isn't even my house anymore. I don't know what this is. 
[354]Come here, Jack. 
[355]You know, Jack, we're going to have to move away from here someday. We're going to have to get our own house. And a yard. We're going to have to do all kinds of things. 
[356]Thank you. Thank you so much. I hope they all know how much their thoughts and prayers have meant the last few weeks. To our whole family. 
[357]He is. He's my life. I never could have survived without him. 
[358]I... I didn't think about it. I didn't plan it. When I found out I was pregnant with Jack, it just seemed like a terrible joke. You know? To bring someone into that place, it just seemed so wrong. I was in a very scary frame of mind. I thought the devil was controlling my life. In a way he was. 
[359]Then, everything was different once Jack came, because he was so beautiful and I had to keep him safe. 
[360]Jack's not his. 
[361]A father's a man who loves his kid. 
[362]That's not a relationship. Jack's nobody's but mine. 
[363]In this whole story, that's the shocking detail? 
[364]Away? 
[365]Why would I - 
[366]He had me. 
[367]Is he there? Put him on. 
[368]Jack? 
[369]Are you doing OK? 
[370]What's that? 
[371]I wish I could. I just need to - 
[372]I'm sorry, Jack. 
[373]I promise. 
[374]Starting to be. 
[375]I'll always keep this with me, Jack. 
[376]I will never, ever let it go. When Grandma brought it to me, I... I knew I could get well. You saved me. Again. 
[377]Sorry. There's none left. 
[378]I'm not a good enough Ma. 
[379]I am. 
[380]Definitely. Making new friends. 
[381]Taken away for evidence. Proof that we were here. 
[382]What? 
[383]Do you - would you like it closed? 
[384]I have to go now. Is there... anything you need? 
[385]Jack - 
[386]Please, Jack.
dialogues.JACK:
[1]You cried all day and left TV on till you were a zombie. But then I zoomed down from heaven through Skylight into Room - and I was kicking you from the inside, boom boom, and then I shot out onto Rug with my eyes wide open, and you cutted the cord and said "Hello Jack." 
[2]Ma. I'm five! 
[3]Morning lamp, Morning rug, Morning wardrobe .. 
[4]Morning Eggsnake. It's my birthday. I'm five. 
[5]Is Bad Tooth hurting? 
[6]If we don't mind, it doesn't matter. 
[7]What? 
[8]A birthday cake, like in TV? 
[9]You, pink soft, pink swirls. 
[10]Me, bear and jeans. 
[11]Just one more planet. 
[12]I'm not very taller after four. 
[13]Yeah? 
[14]Okey-dokey. 
[15]That's where Red Pen died and we got Black Pen for Sunday Treat. Hey, what about cookies? 
[16]I'm going to grow and grow till I'm a giant. Look, Ma. Look how big my superpowers are already. 
[17]Huger every day. 
[18]Enormous. Hugeormous. 
[19]I'm going to be Jack the Giant Giant-Killer and burst out of Skylight into Space with my dog Lucky and boing boing boing between all the planets... 
[20]I can read them all but I like when you do. 
[21]Our friend Spoon, sings to the moon. 
[22]Now the candles. 
[23]You said a birthday cake for real. That means candles on fire. 
[24]You should ask for candles for Sunday Treat, not dumb jeans. 
[25]But Old Nick gets anything, by magic. 
[26]Next week when I'm six you better ask for real candles. 
[27]Ha ha. 
[28]Does he drown? 
[29]Laundry Time. 
[30]Can we have more birthday cake? 
[31]Just a bite. 
[32]One more story? 
[33]Five. 
[34]One, two, three, four... 
[35]There's Room, then Outer Space, then Heaven. Plant is real but not trees. Spiders are real and one time the mosquito that was sucking my blood. But squirrels and dogs are just TV, except Lucky my dog that might be some day. Mountains are too big to be real and the sea. 
[36]One twenty-eight, one twenty- nine... 
[37]TV persons are flat and made of colors with red mouths and clothes instead of skin but me and you are real. Old Nick I don't know if he's real, maybe half? Green beans are real and chocolate but not ice cream. 
[38]Three hundred six, seven, eight - 
[39]Why Plant doesn't make flowers anymore? 
[40]You made him gone! 
[41]He was an alive thing, he was real! 
[42]Mouse can have my food, I'm not hungry. 
[43]Mouse is my friend and you splatted him dead. 
[44]Are you just tricking me? 
[45]What backyard? 
[46]Mouse lives in a yard in TV? 
[47]Why you didn't tell Old Nick it was my birthday? 
[48]He said he'd brung me a present. 
[49]I never had a present. 
[50]It might be Lucky my dog. 
[51]Lucky won't scratch, he promises. 
[52]Yeah there is. 
[53]Ma. Where are we when we're asleep? 
[54]But dreams. Do we go into TV for dreaming? 
[55]I want some. 
[56]Ma! I think Old Nick lives in TV, like Mouse. That's where he goes when he's not here in Room. 
[57]I can do it. 
[58]Why the aliens never scream back? 
[59]Tomorrow we'll do even louderer. 
[60]What smells bad? 
[61]Sorry I - sorry - sorry - 
[62]Sorry I came out of Wardrobe. 
[63]Ma, we're dragons. 
[64]For, you see, so many out-of-the- way things had happened lat-ely - 
[65]- lately, that Alice had begun to think that very few things indeed were really impossible. 
[66]No thanks. 
[67]When's Old Nick going to put the power back? 
[68]When's soon? 
[69]I hope he never comes back not ever. 
[70]No Sunday Treat? 
[71]My friend Mouse? 
[72]What other side? 
[73]Not an octagon. 
[74]An octagon has eight. 
[75]In Outer Space? 
[76]I don't see any outside side. 
[77]Grass is just TV. 
[78]You can't smell TV. 
[79]From TV by magic. 
[80]Dora's real for real? 
[81]No way. Where would they all fit? 
[82]Can I have a sandwich? 
[83]Where? 
[84]Dumbo Ma. That's not a leaf. Leaves are green. 
[85]Where's all the stuff you said? Trees and dogs and - 
[86]You're just tricking me. 
[87]Liar liar pants on fire! 
[88]I want to be four again. 
[89]She fell down down down the hole. 
[90]Nah! 
[91]What house? 
[92]A TV house? 
[93]Where was I? 
[94]What guy? 
[95]What's the dog's name? 
[96]I want a different story. 
[97]Where? 
[98]This story's boring. 
[99]Room's not stinky.   Only when you do a fart. 
[100]I don't believe in your stinky world.

dialogues.HOSTESS:
[1]...most poignant aspect, I can speak for all our viewers, so, so deeply moved by what you endured.

[6]You made life as normal and nurturing as you could given the environment. You gave him a childhood. How did you manage to do that? 
[7]Are you okay?

[11]So true, in a very real sense, but the genetic relationship - 
[12]You breastfed Jack for five years - in fact, viewers may be startled to learn that you still do. 
[13]Did it ever occur to you to ask your captor to take Jack away?

[15]So Jack could be free. The ultimate sacrifice, of course, but for him to have a normal childhood...
